title: p', q', and EBP
text: Let X $$=$$ the number of people in the sample who have cell phones. X ~ B (500, 421/500). To calculate the confidence interval, you must find p', q', and EBP.

title: p' Equation
text: p', the estimated proportion of successes, is equal to the number of successes (x) divided by the size of the sample (n): p' $$=$$ $$\frac{x}{n}$$

title: Sample Size
text: What is the size of the sample (n)?

title: Number of Successes
text: What is the number of successes (x)?
